@gid3xn I understand and youâ€™re right that laws apply, but from the enforcement standpoint thereâ€™s still a long way to go, and unfortunately thereâ€™s a lot of gray area remains in the space

@gid3xn I see your point and generally agree. But, letâ€™s say want to initiate a lawsuit against a DAO, how would you proceed? And then even if some court says your liable for something, how do you enforce a DAO to do something or shut it down?
@gid3xn You can't institute legal proceedings against a DAO atm, no legal system has a framework for that yet, but I don't know how this will evolve over time

@gid3xn A DAO is not a registered legal entity, so it doesn't exist on paper in any legal jurisdiction, only in the web3 world. However individuals, members of the DAO, do exist as citizens or residents locally. Hope this makes sense
